Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Thursday August 21), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing'

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for thursday, august 21st. google has announced a significant development in its artificial intelligence capabilities with the debut of a new ai model that dramatically enhances translation services. the company claims that this model offers more accurate translations and smoother transitions between languages, aiming to bridge communication gaps across the globe.

in the world of social media, meta platforms, the parent company of facebook and instagram, is launching a suite of new monetization tools for creators. these innovations include enhanced ad-sharing revenue systems and premium subscription offerings designed to increase income streams for digital influencers, as meta remains committed to growing its creator ecosystem.

turning to the semiconductor industry, nvidia's stock has surged today after the company reported record-breaking revenue that exceeded wall street's expectations. nvidia has been a key player in supplying high-performance graphics processors for the gaming and ai sectors. their robust sales figures highlight strong demand in gaming and the booming interest in ai-driven applications.

lastly, amazon is facing scrutiny from regulators in europe over its use of customer data. the european commission has raised concerns about how amazon allegedly collects and utilizes third-party seller data to gain an unfair competitive advantage. amazon maintains that its practices comply with all relevant laws and regulations.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, august 21st.

starting with google, the tech giant has unveiled a groundbreaking ai model that significantly boosts its translation services. with claims of providing more accurate translations and smoother language transitions, google aims to break down communication barriers around the globe.

in social media news, meta platforms, the parent company of facebook and instagram, is rolling out a new suite of monetization tools for creators. these include enhanced ad-sharing revenue systems and premium subscription offerings, all designed to expand income avenues for digital influencers. meta is reinforcing its commitment to nurturing its creator ecosystem.

shifting to the semiconductor industry, nvidia shares have surged following a report of record-breaking revenue that surpassed wall street's expectations. as a critical supplier of high-performance graphics processors for both gaming and ai sectors, nvidia's strong sales numbers underscore robust demand and the increasing interest in ai-powered applications.

lastly, amazon is facing scrutiny from european regulators over its use of customer data. the european commission has expressed concerns regarding amazon’s alleged practices of collecting and utilizing third-party seller data for an unfair competitive edge. amazon insists that it complies with all applicable laws and regulations.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-349 Google's New Ai Translation Model 🌍, Meta's Creator Monetization Tools 📈, Nvidia's Revenue Surge 💹
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for thursday, august 21st. dive into the latest tech stories:

  • google's ai translation breakthrough: introduction of a new ai model enhancing translation services for more accurate and smoother language transitions, aiming to break global communication barriers.
  • meta's monetization tools for creators: rollout of new ad-sharing revenue systems and premium subscriptions to expand income opportunities for digital influencers on facebook and instagram.
  • nvidia's record-breaking revenue: surge in shares following reports of exceeding wall street expectations, highlighting strong demand for graphics processors in gaming and ai sectors.
  • amazon's european regulatory scrutiny: investigation by european regulators into amazon's use of customer data, with concerns over competitive practices involving third-party seller data.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow!
